oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Abū Muḥammad Suwayd
مقابلة مع أبو محمد سويد
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Moses (Biblical leader)--In the Qurʼan
Moses, (Biblical leader)--Islamic interpretations
Religious education--Palestine
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Armies; Āsiyā, wife of Pharaoh; Child homicide; Childbirth; Copts; Crates; Daughters; Disputes; Dream interpretation; Egypt; Gabriel (Archangel); God's will; Hārūn bin ʻImrān, Prophet; Illness; Immigration; Israelites; Love; Miracles; Muḥammad, Prophet, 571-633; Murder; Pregnancies; Promises; Qurʼān stories; Rape; Regret; Torture; Daughters; Disputes; Emotions; Ezekiel (Biblical prophet); Hārūn bin ʻImrān, Prophet; Hiding; Marriage; Miracles; Moses (Biblical leader); Muḥammad, Prophet, 571-633; Pharaohs; Qurʼān stories; Shuʻayb (Prophet); Supernatural elements; Water wells; Armies; Egypt; Emotions; God's will; Guards; Hārūn bin ʻImrān, Prophet; Pharaohs; Prayers; Qurʼān stories; Snakes; Supernatural elements; Wizards; Āsiyā, wife of Pharaoh; Copts; Crucifixion; Ezekiel (Biblical prophet); Faith; Fleas; Floods; Frogs; Gabriel (Archangel); God's will; Locust infestation; Muḥammad, Prophet, 571-633; Pharaohs; Prayers; Qurʼān stories; Revenge; Supernatural elements; Torture; Water resources; Angels; Atheists; Believers; Copts; Desserts; Gabriel (Archangel); God; Holy Lands; Horses; Israelites; Jews; Joseph (Son of Jacob); Muḥammad, Prophet, 571-633; Pharaoh; Prayers; Qurʼān stories; Secrecy; Supernatural events; Symbolism
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on January 18, 1996 with Abū Muḥammad Suwayd, male, born in 1946 in Safad, Palestine and resides in al-Baddāwī Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع أبو محمد سويد في 18 تشرين الثاني عام 1996، ذكر، ولد عام 1946 في صفد، فلسطين ويقيم في مخيم البداوي للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: The birth of Moses and survival from Pharaoh's execution . (@ 0:00)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: ولادة النبي موسى ونجاته من فرعون.(@ 0:00)
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: Escape of Moses from executioners and his first contact with God . (@ 28:18)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: فرار النبي موسى من مطارديه وتواصله الأول مع الله. (@ 28:18)
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: Return of Moses to Egypt and his miracles . (@ 44:4)
God's messages to people through Moses and oppression of his believers . (@ 53:19)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: رسالة الله إلى الناس عبر موسى وقمع المؤمنين به. (@ 53:19)
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: Separation of the sea by Moses and death of the Pharaoh. (@ 68:56)
